https://prez.dev/description.@value: The status of this register entry
The subject is an instance of a class.
The property that identifies the version IRI of an ontology.
A set of concepts, optionally including statements about semantic relationships between those concepts
A statement or formal explanation of the meaning of a concept
Relates, by convention, a concept scheme to a concept which is topmost in the broader/narrower concept hierarchies for that scheme, providing an entry point to these hierarchies
A note about the past state/use/meaning of a concept
The preferred lexical label for a resource, in a given language
If this Entity prov:wasAttributedTo Agent :ag, then it can qualify how it was influenced using prov:qualifiedAttribution [ a prov:Attribution;  prov:agent :ag; :foo :bar ].

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: A categorization of disciplines or topics that the broad field of Earth science can be subdivided into, i.e. a listing of the Fields of Research, or subjects, to which a geoscience dataset, publication, observation/activity, or entity pertains. The vocabulary also contains relevant disciplines that intersect with the various Earth science fields, such as biological sciences and built environment and design, as well as entries related to collection and heritage management. Notations included are those from the 2020 ANZSRC listing (see History Note) or in common use in the geoscience community.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#hist.@value: The listing combines Earth Science-related entries in the Fields of Research vocabulary from the 2020 Australian and New Zealand Standard Research Classification (ANZSRC, https://vocabs.ardc.edu.au/viewById/316 and https://www.abs.gov.au/statistics/classifications/australian-and-new-zealand-standard-research-classification-anzsrc/latest-release), selected additions from the Geological Survey of Queensland (GSQ)'s Earth Science Data Category vocabulary (http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category), and supplementary concepts of relevance to the work of the Geological Survey of Western Australia (GSWA) and partner industry and research institutions. Definitions used are largely derived from: (a) the Glossary of Geology (Neuendorf, KKE, Mehl Jr, JP and Jackson, JA (editors) 2011, Glossary of geology (5th edition, revised): American Geosciences Institute, Alexandria, Virginia, USA, 800p.), (b) Wikipedia (https://www.wikipedia.org/), (c) the GSQ's earth Science Data Category vocabulary (http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category), and many other online resources.

https://prez.dev/description.@value: A categorization of disciplines or topics that the broad field of Earth science can be subdivided into, i.e. a listing of the Fields of Research, or subjects, to which a geoscience dataset, publication, observation/activity, or entity pertains. The vocabulary also contains relevant disciplines that intersect with the various Earth science fields, such as biological sciences and built environment and design, as well as entries related to collection and heritage management. Notations included are those from the 2020 ANZSRC listing (see History Note) or in common use in the geoscience community.
An entry that is seen as having a reasonable measure of stability, may be used to mark the full adoption of a previously 'experimental' entry.
A profile for SKOS Concept Schemes
The creator/author of this CreativeWork. This is the same as the Author property for CreativeWork
The date on which the CreativeWork was created or the item was added to a DataFeed
The date on which the CreativeWork was most recently modified or when the item's entry was modified within a DataFeed
Keywords or tags used to describe some item. Multiple textual entries in a keywords list are typically delimited by commas, or by repeating the property
The publisher of the creative work
The version of the CreativeWork embodied by a specified resource
